relation: Great for these types of students
Athletic, people who love the outdoors, people who make their own fun.
Hang out with friends, go to the purple pig etc..
From what i've eaten, it was pretty good. Not great, but good.
Several of the programs at Adams State are great!
My tip to students is to make sure you have a car and can drive. Also, be prepared for the tiny dorms!
Adams state is a great school. I completely fell in love with this school as soon as I walked on the campus. The town, Alamosa, has qualities that you will fall in love with.
pageTitle: Adams State University Reviews: Student Reviews and Ratings | Cappex
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {82543=Summerfest on the Rio in June is a big hit with lots of music, food and fun. The school itself also does fun events monthly around campus like movie night, concerts and many more., 22054=Stock up on the DVDs and take advantage of the on-campus cable. It's usually sunny and windy. In August it's really hot, but it gets cold quickly, really cold. Be prepared for professors to recognize you outside of class, they'll know when you're skipping., 171578=© 2015, Cappex.com, LLC}

textAfterTable: Categories Comments Bang for the buck I am pretty ecstatic about how convenient the cost to go to Adams State is. It really is hard to find a quality college such as this one that has a low cost. ASC is really a hit when it comes to the financial matter. Am enjoying being here Coming from a the city of Denver, I have never been close to living in such a natural, small town like Alamosa. It is a big change coming from the city but I enjoy being here because there are a lot of outdoor activities to fill the day with. Am learning a lot I chose to rate my learning experience at Adams State College a four because all the professors that I have had classes with are more than eligible to teach in their fields. I am finding that I learn more everyday than I did back at my high school. I'm thrilled to return to ASC my sophomore year. Login to rate or flag the reviews Jennifer from Bedford, NH 03/26/2012
